titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jack Miles papers MS.F.045
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Laura Uglean Jackson, 2017; updated by Sarah Glover, 2018-2021; updated by Gabrielle Wood, 2023.

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections and Archives, University of California, Irvine Libraries

repository.corpname: Special Collections and Archives, University of California, Irvine Libraries

did.unittitle: Jack Miles papers

physdesc.extent: (14 records cartons, 4 document box, 1 flat box, 1 trophy box, 1 small artifact box, 1 audiovisual box, 1 digital media box, and 1 oversize folder)

did.abstract: This collection comprises the papers of Jack Miles, Pulitzer Prize winning author, MacArthur Fellow, and Distinguished Professor Emeritus of English and Religious Studies at the University of California, Irvine. The papers consist of professional, scholarly, and personal materials documenting his life and career, including publications, books, correspondence, teaching materials, speaking engagements, fellowships and memberships, and biographical material.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research. Access to original audiovisual material and digital media is restricted; researchers may request viewing or listening copies.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the University of California. Copyrights are retained by the creators of the records and their heirs. For permission to reproduce or to publish, please contact the University Archivist. Digital material is provided for private study, scholarship, or research. Transmission or reproduction of any material protected by copyright beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. The authors or their heirs retain their copyrights to the material. Contact the University of California, Irvine Libraries, Special Collections and Archives for more information (spcoll@uci.edu).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jack Miles papers. MS-F045. Special Collections and Archives, The UC Irvine Libraries, Irvine, California. Date accessed.

For the benefit of current and future researchers, please cite any additional information about sources consulted in this collection, including permanent URLs, item or folder descriptions, and box/folder locations.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Sarah Glover, 2018-2021. Updated by Gabrielle Wood, 2023.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: John R. "Jack" Miles is a Pulitzer Prize winning author, MacArthur Fellow, and Distinguished Professor Emeritus of English & Religious Studies at the University of California, Irvine.

Miles was born in Chicago, Illinois, on July 30, 1942. He attended high school at St. Ignatius College Preparatory School. Between 1960-1970, he was a Jesuit seminarian studying at the Pontifical Gregorian University in Rome and the Hebrew University in Jerusalem. He completed a Ph.D. in Near Eastern languages at Harvard University in 1971.

Miles is a writer whose work has appeared in The Atlantic, The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Los Angeles Times, The Boston Globe, Commonweal, among others. His book God: A Biography won a Pulitzer Prize in 1996 and has been translated into sixteen languages. A sequel to the book entitled, Christ: A Crisis in the Life of God, was published in 2001 and led to Miles being named a MacArthur Fellow in 2002. The third book in the God in Three Classic Scriptures series, God in the Qur'an, was published in 2018. In 2022 Miles published another books titled,'A Friendship in Twilight: Lockdown Conversations on Death and Life' with Mark C. Taylor, composed of letters written by the pair between March 15 to May 14, 2020 detailing their thoughts on the Covid-19 Pandemic, racial inequality in US, higher education, the 2020 election, religion, philosophy,family, history, and a host of other topics.

Between 1975 and 1995, Miles was an editor at Doubleday; executive editor at the University of California Press; literary editor at the Los Angeles Times; and a member of the Times Editorial Board, writing on politics and culture. For ten years, he served on the Committee of Selection of the John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation. He was also the general editor of The Norton Anthology of World Religions, which was published in 2014.

Miles is a Distinguished Professor Emeritus of English and Religious Studies at the University of California, Irvine, and Senior Fellow for Religion and International Affairs with the Pacific Council on International Policy. He has been a Mellon Visiting Professor of Humanities at Caltech, Director of the Humanities Center at the Claremont Graduate University, Scholar in Residence and Senior Advisor at the J. Paul Getty Trust, and a Visiting Fellow with the Committee on the Conceptual Foundations of Science, University of Chicago.
Miles is married to Catherine "Kitty" Miles and is the father of Kathleen Miles.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This collection comprises the professional and personal papers of Jack Miles, which document his career as a writer, editor, and professor of English and Religious Studies. Materials in the collection include drafts and copies of his books and articles, unpublished works, edited anthologies and articles, correspondence, teaching materials, speaking engagements, fellowships and memberships, and biographical material which includes documentation of his early life, high school memorabilia, and awards.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized in the following six series:

list.item: Writings and editing, 1969-2021. 9.75 linear feet and 0.00102 GB

appraisal.head: Appraisal Note
appraisal.p: During processing the collection was reduced from 23.75 linear feet to 16.95 linear feet by discarding duplicate materials, material under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), and materials outside of the scope of the collection.

otherfindaid.head: Additional Collection Guides
otherfindaid.p: A file list inventory of the digital files is available via this link: Jack Miles papers born digital directory.

did.unittitle: Writings and editing

scopecontent.head: Series Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This series consists of material related to books written by Miles; an extensive collection of articles, essays, reviews, and op-eds written by Miles; his doctoral thesis, written in November 1970; material related to his time as general editor of the Norton Anthology of World Religions; and works he contributed to publications or collaborated on with other authors and artists. The series also contains correspondence, photographs and negatives, digital media, research files, and notes in relation to the writings and editings.

arrangement.head: Series Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged in its original order.

processinfo.head: Processing Note
processinfo.p: Some files in this series were not labeled clearly and titles were supplied during processing to clarify file contents. If folder labels were available, those titles were preserved with minimal revisions to clarify contents.

did.unittitle: Books

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of material related to the three books written by Jack Miles in the God in Three Classic Scriptures series: God: A Biography, Christ: A Crisis in the Life of God, and God in the Qur'an. It includes early versions, drafts, first-pass proofs and uncorrected proofs of the works; notes about the design of the books and revisions; publicity and articles about the books and winning the Pulitzer Prize in 1996 for God: A Biography; interviews; reviews; and correspondence. It also contains some digital files (see Additional Collection Guides for access), floppy disks, and audio cassettes related to the books. The subseries also contains drafts of and materials relating to the books Religion As We Know It: An Origin Story (2019) and A Friendship in Twilight: Lockdown Letters on Death and Life with Mark C. Taylor. Some folders contain notes from Jack Miles in 2017 to provide more context about the materials.

did.unittitle: Articles, essays, thesis, and reviews

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of articles, essays, op-eds, reviews of other people's work, his doctoral thesis, and unpublished writings by Jack Miles. It includes writings featured in the Los Angeles Times, The Atlantic, Commonweal, The New York Times, The Washington Post, The Boston Globe, as well as various journals, anthologies, and websites. The topics of the articles range from the Iraq War to climate change, from the Los Angeles riots in the 1990s to same-sex marriage. The subseries also contains clippings from when Miles served as Los Angeles Times editor. Some folders include correspondence, drafts, notes, research, photographs, and other material related to each piece of writing. Some folders contain notes from Jack Miles in 2017 to provide more context about the materials.

The Norton Anthology of World Religions (NAWR)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of material collected by Miles as the general editor of The Norton Anthology of World Religions, which was published in 2014. The anthology "offers a portable library of more than 1,000 primary texts from the world's major religions: Hinduism, Buddhism, and Daoism (Volume 1); and Judaism, Christianity, and Islam (Volume 2)". The folders contain drafts, revisions, and proofs; correspondence; an evaluation as Distinguished Professor for University of California, Irvine with documentation on the anthology; contracts with all seven scholars including Miles; preliminary outlines and key documents; guidelines and reports; information about the companion website; a Getty program linked to the anthology that Miles appeared at; reviews and responses; talk notes; research files; and ideas for a blog and companion textbook that were not used. Many of the folders include notes about the material written by Miles in 2017.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of writings Miles contributed to other people's books, such as introductions and forewords; collaborations, most notably with artist Lisa Ruyters when he provided text to accompany her work, "Stations of the Cross"; and material related to his time on the editorial committee of University of California Press. Some of the folders contain correspondence, research and reference files, photographs and negatives, publicity, and notes by Miles in 2017 providing more context to the material.

Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Series Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This series consists of correspondence to and from Jack Miles in both a professional and personal capacity. The majority of the general correspondence, which consists of letters to Jack Miles, is made up of letters of congratulations when he won the Pulitzer Prize in 1996 for God: A Biography. It also includes a letter from President Bill Clinton in 1997 (Box 8, Folder 8), and letters from President Joe Biden and Congressman Adam Schiff in 2020-2021 (Box 15, Folder 30). There is also a run of letters sent by Jack Miles to politicians, colleagues, and family members. There are individual folders for certain correspondents that Miles singled out - most notably Philip Roth (who also appears in the general correspondence/letters sent) and his biographer, Blake Bailey; the poet Todd Boss; philosopher Mark C. Taylor; painter Frederick Franck and his son Lukas Franck; and philosopher George Dennis O'Brien. The series also contains a chronological file of correspondence from Miles' time as a professor at UCI, as well as early letters sent by Miles to his family in the early 1960s from Ohio while he was studying at Xavier University and Europe while he was studying at the Pontifical Gregorian University in Rome. Some of the correspondence contains writings of others that Miles critiqued or edited, as well as notes written by Miles in 2017 to give the correspondence more context.

arrangement.head: Series Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is physically arranged in its original order.

processinfo.head: Processing Note
processinfo.p: The folders originally titled "misc. rec'd/rec'd misc.", "chron.", and "ipse" were reorganized. Many of these folders contained correspondence but also ephemera, material sent by other people, photographs, and online print-outs. The folders were organized into: general correspondence (most from the "misc. rec'd" folders), copies of letters sent (most from the "chron." folders), personal materials (such as cards from family/friends, ephemera with annotations, photographs, clippings, and ephemera about family members), other series (these were separated out further into series), and items to discard (writings of others without annotations, leaflets/flyers, other ephemera unrelated to Miles, and items with personally identifiable information).

scopecontent.head: Series Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This series consists of teaching materials from the various colleges Miles has taught at, including UCI, Occidental College, Loyola University of Chicago, and Claremont Graduate University. Materials include class notes and slides; syllabi; faculty profiles; correspondence; exam questions; notes for courses never taught; memorabilia related to Miles' involvement as judge, jury chair, and director of the Kingsley Tufts Poetry Awards program at Claremont Graduate University; and information about the Chairs controversy at UCI. Many of the folders include notes written by Miles in 2017 to give more context to the materials.

arrangement.head: Series Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged in its original order.

scopecontent.head: Series Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This series contains material related to speaking engagements Jack Miles participated in. Materials include drafts and transcripts of talks at conferences and symposiums; transcripts of interviews on NPR; lecture notes; research files; previously unpublished remarks, and audiovisual material. The series also contains information from when Miles was asked to speak at UCI commencement in 2008 but also asked to by the union American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees due to striking service employees. Miles wrote an op-ed in support of the strikers and a fair contract, and collected correspondence and other related material. He also spoke at a UC Regents Meeting about the negotiations in September 2008. The folders include his canceled commencement address, correspondence, newspaper articles, court documents, information from AFSCME, information related to a UC regents meeting, and notes. Many of the folders in the series contain notes by Miles in 2017 to give the materials more context.

arrangement.head: Series Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged in its original order.

did.unittitle: Fellowships and memberships

scopecontent.head: Series Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This series consists of material related to Miles as a Fellow or member of organizations. The material includes project proposals, a preliminary biography, flyers, writing, and ephemera related to his Getty Research Institute Fellowship in 2006-2007; a J. Paul Getty Trust oral history transcript about his time as a Scholar in Residence and Senior Advisor at the J. Paul Getty Trust; and material related to his membership of the Pacific Council on International Policy (PCIP) including correspondence about work he did as a Senior Fellow for Religion and International Relations, notes, research and reference material, a book plan, background and policies of the organization, memos, reports, proposals for a guest lecture series, and information related to events.

arrangement.head: Series Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged in its original order.

Biographical

scopecontent.head: Series Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This series consists of biographical and personal material related to Jack Miles. Material includes digital photographs of Miles and family members through the years and digital descendants/pedigree charts (see Additional Collection Guides for access); school and early life memorabilia such as a Youth Achievement Award from St. Ignatius College Preparatory School; photographs of Miles as editor of his high school newspaper, "Spirit", with copies of the newspaper; a laminated newspaper article about him entering seminary; school transcripts; scholarship information and confirmation documents; awards and certificates through the years; biographical statements and curriculum vitae; poetry for family members; a booklet from the State of the Union Address to the 104th Congress signed to Miles by President Bill Clinton; and real estate and landlording documents.

arrangement.head: Series Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged in its original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: This accession contains materials relating to Jack Miles' 2022 book 'A Friendship in Twilight: Lockdown Conversations on Death and Life' co authored by Mark C. Taylor, correspondence with fellow writers, shorter publications, and articles that shaped the authors discussions.

arrangement.head: Series Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged in its original order.

did.unittitle: Plague Diaries letters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: This accession contains materials relating to Jack Miles' 2022 book 'A Friendship in Twilight: Lockdown Conversations on Death and Life' co authored by Mark C. Taylor. The book contains a one quarter to one third of the email letters written by Miles and Taylor from March 15 to May 14, 2020 and details the pairs thoughts on the Covid-19 Pandemic, racial inequality in US, higher education, the 2020 election, religion, philosophy, family, history, and a host of other topics. This accession is comprised of a selection of letters that were not published in the book.

did.unittitle: Plague Diaries letters
Correspondence and shorter publications

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: These correspondence materials pertain to conversations with other writers, such as novelist Viet Thanh Nguyen, as well as copies of Miles' remarks from the 2022 induction of UCI graduates into the Phi Beta Kappa Society on June 9th, 2022 and talk given at "What Matters to Me and Why" series at UCI which was subsequently lightly adapted and published in 'The American Scholar'.

did.unittitle: Correspondence and shorter publications
Articles and book extras

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: These materials contain articles that Miles and Taylor used to inform and shape their discussions about politics, health, religion, ect. as well as notes pertaining to their book planning process and extra book content.
